image.altText: Devarshi Deka with his father, mother and his friend Rick Kaushik

props.synopsis: A tearful Devarshi Deka and family thank those who have played a part in the successful campaign for him to secure permanent residency in Australia and, with it, ongoing health care.

title.children: 'I appreciate this with my whole heart': International student's emotional response to community support

image.altText: a man holds a bike infront of a bay with mountain behind.

props.synopsis: Sam Ralph says he felt a real sense of excitement when a sprawling green hub for his community on Hobart's eastern shore was proposed three years ago, but a plan for an AFL training ground has shifted the goal posts.

title.children: 'It's made me think of moving': Council planned a huge urban green space, but then an AFL proposal took over

image.altText: Yellow bird on a branch in an aviary.

props.synopsis: Tweety the yellow-tailed black cockatoo is mostly yellow due to a rare condition. While that has resulted in it being shunned by its kin in the wild, collectors see Tweety as a prize â€” and that is a problem.

title.children: Rare condition puts Tweety the yellow-tailed black cockatoo at risk of bird collectors

image.altText: Australians Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan stand together smiling on the podium, wearing their silver and gold medals.

props.synopsis: Ariarne Titmus and Mollie O'Callaghan meet in the women's 200 metres freestyle final in one of the biggest races of the Olympic schedule. Follow live.

title.children: O'Callaghan and Titmus create Australian Olympic history with gold and silver in 200m freestyle

image.altText: A large number of police officers standing on a street, speaking

props.synopsis: Two children are killed and nine more are injured during a stabbing attack in England's north-west that one witness likens to a "horror movie".

title.children: 'Worst thing I've ever seen': Two children killed and nine injured in UK stabbing attack

image.altText: You view an aerial photo of Beirut Airport's three long runways up against a topaz sea and cityscape climbing up nearby hills.

props.synopsis: Flights to and from Beirut are cancelled or delayed and Australians in Lebanon are warned to leave immediately as tensions between Israel and Hezbollah escalate.

title.children: Australians warned not to travel to Lebanon as tensions between Israel and Hezbollah rise

image.altText: A graphic of a hand asking for money.

props.synopsis: Australian businesses are paying untold amounts in ransom to hackers but the government hopes to regain some control with a landmark cybersecurity law.

title.children: Most cyber ransoms are paid in secret but a new law could change that

image.altText: Michele Bullock, looking at journalists, wearing a light blazer, standing at a podium, during a press conference

props.synopsis: Ahead of its meeting next week, the RBA has effectively talked itself into a corner: should it come good on its threats of a rate hike if inflation comes in hotter than expected, or will it choose to maintain its apparent reluctance to push rates even higher?

title.children: With higher inflation on the horizon, the RBA could find itself entering murky waters

image.altText: An Australian flag flies at the Australian embassy in Jakarta after a bomb attack

props.synopsis: In 2002, Jemaah Islamiyah became the most feared terror group in South-East Asia. Now they have publicly renounced violence.

title.children: The extremist group behind the Bali bombings says it has disbanded. Can it be believed?

image.altText: british sea lord

props.synopsis: Britain's visiting naval chief has declared Australia will eventually operate the world's best anti-submarine warfare (ASW) frigates because a closely linked shipbuilding project in the UK is now "stabilising" after suffering damaging initial setbacks.

title.children: British sea lord assures Australian officials troubled warship program 'stabilising'

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: A new visa that was quietly introduced last week is already giving hope to migrant workers who are battling for justice against exploitation, a leading legal advocate says.

title.children: What we know about a new visa allowing migrants to stay in Australia to take on bosses who exploit them

image.altText: Joe Biden speaking into a microphone in front of an American flag

props.synopsis: US President Joe Biden proposes sweeping reforms to the Supreme Court, including term limits and a binding code of conduct for its nine justices, but a deeply-divided Congress means the changes have little chance of becoming law.

title.children: 'No one is above the law': Biden bids to overhaul US supreme court, presidential immunity

image.altText: David Crisafulli graphic

props.synopsis: The man likely to become Queensland's next premier touts his time in small business, but an ABC examination has uncovered liquidators' claims a training organisation he was directing may have been trading insolvent.

title.children: Opposition Leader David Crisafulli ran a training company liquidators believed may have been trading insolvent

image.altText: A text message inducement to gamble sent by Sportsbet

props.synopsis: Gambling inducements are banned in many countries and a parliamentary committee has recommended Australia follow suit, but more than a year later nothing has happened.

title.children: Callum stopped gambling a year ago. Sportsbet is still trying to lure him back

image.altText: Novak Djokovic looks at Rafael Nadal

props.synopsis: If this was the last time Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic meet in a major tennis match, then it was a fitting if heartbreaking finale, as the pair come full circle back to where they first met.

title.children: Djokovic and Nadal come full circle in a final, heartbreakingly lopsided encounter

image.altText: A crowd dressed in black is gathered at a rally

props.synopsis:
Israel and Hezbollah last went to war in 2006, but now, with tensions sky high, all-out war looms again amid the Gaza conflict and the Arab world's fight against the West in the name of the Palestinian cause.
Â

title.children: After 18 years on the fringes, the Middle East's most powerful paramilitary group and its biggest foe now sit on the verge of war

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears high-vis and a hard hat.

props.synopsis: As Anthony Albanese moves ahead with his Future Made in Australia plan, key stakeholders raise questions about how the scheme will be managed and what rules will apply.

title.children: Should gas giants get subsidies under the PM's signature clean energy scheme?

image.altText: A man walks next to a girl who stares at him adoringly with a hand on his chest

props.synopsis: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un is preparing his teenage daughter to lead the nuclear-armed state after his death, according to South Korean MPs briefed by Seoul's spy agency.

title.children: Intelligence service says Kim Jong Un preparing daughter to lead North Korea

image.altText: BBC newsreaderÂ HuwÂ Edwards speaks in suit.

props.synopsis: London's Metropolitan Police say Huw Edwards, who was once one of the BBC's biggest stars, has been charged with three counts of making indecent pictures of children and will face court later this week.

title.children: Former BBC presenter Huw Edwards charged with making indecent images of children

image.altText: The badly damaged front of a train is seen in foreground, with derailed carriages behind

props.synopsis: A passenger train carrying 800 people collides with a truck in Russia's south-west, causing a number of the carriages to derail.

title.children: Train and truck collide in Russia, killing two and injuring more than 100

image.altText: A crowd waiting around screens at a train station.

props.synopsis: The man was arrested at a railway site on Sunday after three coordinated arson attacks paralysed most of France's high-speed railway network over the opening weekend of the Paris Olympics.

title.children: Man arrested over French railway arson attacks

image.altText: A moustached middle-aged South American man thanks a crowd as he wears a red, yellow and blue starred jacket

props.synopsis: The current president claims a third term in the South American country as the opposition and international observers say exit polls suggest a different result.

title.children: Venezuelan election ends in disputed win for incumbent NicolÃ¡s Maduro

image.altText: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese Blue Room

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese challenges the opposition leader to sack Barnaby Joyce for telling protesters to "load that magazine" and "say goodbye" to the prime minister and other senior Labor figures.

title.children: PM calls for Barnaby Joyce to be sacked for telling voters to use votes as 'bullets'

image.altText: Ariarne Titmus

props.synopsis: As they take their place on the podium after winning a medal, Paris Olympians are being handed a long and skinny box. Here's what's inside.

title.children: Medal-winning athletes are being handed boxes at the Paris Olympics â€” but what's inside?

image.altText: Christopher Burton, on horseback, jumps over a hurdle during the Olympics

props.synopsis: Australia's Chris Burton wins a silver medal in the individual eventing competition at the Chateau of Versailles.

title.children: 'A dream come true': Aussie Burton wins Olympic medal after only five months with horse Shadow Man

image.altText: Two female professional basketballers in action, the one on the left wears green.

props.synopsis: An upset loss to Africa's best national basketball team Nigeria puts the Opals' 2024 Olympic medal hopes in early jeopardy.

title.children: Opals stumble at first hurdle in Paris as 'everything' goes wrong in loss to Nigeria

image.altText: Kamala Harris, in a beige suite, looks over her shoulders at the top of aircraft stairs

props.synopsis: In the extraordinary moment when Donald Trump was left bloodied by a would-be assassin's bullet, the political reality changed. Then, it was the Democrats' turn for a dramatic twist.

title.children: Trump seemed indestructible, but a remarkable new dynamic has emerged in the race for the White House

image.altText: A woman in a suit with short white hair walks forward, flanked by two men in suits.

props.synopsis: Beijing pressures politicians not to attend a China-focused summit in Taiwan as Australian, US, Japanese, and Indian foreign leaders discuss countering Chinese aggression at the Quad meeting in Tokyo.

title.children: Wong announces new cable connectivity centre as Quad meets in Japan

image.altText: Profile photos of two young people.

props.synopsis: An inquest has heard Constable Rachel McCrow recorded a message for her family before she was murdered in the ambush in Queensland in December 2022.

title.children: Court hears officer pleaded with man before being shot dead at Wieambilla

image.altText: Two boxers embrace and hug after their bout.

props.synopsis: After winning Australia's first boxing medal in 33 years in Tokyo, Harry Garside's gold medal hopes have been crushed after losing his first fight in Paris to Hungarian giant-killer Richard Kovacs.

title.children: 'I feel like a failure': Paris heartbreak for Harry Garside as Tokyo bronze medallist makes shock early exit

image.altText: Woman with short blonde hair in red blazer speaks in front of microphone

props.synopsis: Ousted Home Affairs minister Clare O'Neil has vowed her make her job as Housing Minister about "delivery, delivery, delivery" amid ongoing building industry warnings over the speed at which government's $32 billion housing rollout can ease the supply crisis.

title.children: O'Neil says 'a lot of Australians' don't realise scale of Labor's $32 billion housing plan

image.altText: The Belarus team walk together behind its flag

props.synopsis: Athletes are banned from representing Russia and Belarus at this year's Paris Olympic Games, but they can compete as individuals under the banner of the AthlÃ¨tes Individuels Neutres, or AIN.

title.children: What is the AIN at the Paris Olympics?

image.altText: A group of three Olympic medals - with silver, gold and bronze left to right - are shown against a dark background.

props.synopsis: There are a host of Australians in the running for medals on day three in Paris. Check out the full Olympic medal tally.

title.children: Here's the medal standings on day three of the Olympic Games

image.altText: A closeup of one of the secret files about the Kenyan detention camps released by the British government.

props.synopsis: For decades the British government hid secret files about the detention and torture of Kenyan resistance fighters. This is how they were revealed and the horrors they contained.

title.children: How files showing the British tortured and killed resistance fighters 'on a mass scale' were revealed
